Class Tasks

java.lang.Object
Tasks
public class Tasks
extends java.lang.Object
This class works as the pool (queue) of tasks to be solve, threads retreive one task at the time. And a charger can add new tasks if the queue is empty.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Tasks​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> newTasks)
    Constructs a tasks pool.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addTask​(java.lang.Integer newTask)
    Adds a new task into the pool.
    java.lang.Integer getTask()
    Gets a task from the pool.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Tasks

      public Tasks​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> newTasks)
      Constructs a tasks pool. Manages the submit and retrieve of tasks by allowing the threads to work with wait() and notify() when using this object.
      Parameters:
      newTasks - The new tasks to be added into the pool.

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public void addTask​(java.lang.Integer newTask)
      Adds a new task into the pool.

      If a thread is taking a task, the thread triying to add a new task must wait().

      If no thread is taking a task, the new task is added and notifyAll() threads wating.

      Parameters:
      newTask - New task to be added.

    • getTask

      public java.lang.Integer getTask()
      Gets a task from the pool.

      If a thread is adding a task, the thread triying to get a task must wait().

      If no thread is adding a task, the thread triying to get a task obtains and removes it from the pool, then notifyAll() waiting threads if empty.

      Returns:
